meanings.definition: Having lost the physical, mental, or moral qualities considered normal or desirable; showing evidence of decline.
meanings.sent1: The old, degenerate building was falling apart.
meanings.sent2: The degenerate behavior of the students was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The degenerate banana peel slipped on the floor comically.
meanings.sent4: Her degenerate sense of fashion was like a fading sunset.
meanings.sent5: The degenerate smell of the garbage was unbearable.

meanings.sent1: If we don't take care of the garden, it will degenerate.
meanings.sent2: His health started to degenerate after he stopped exercising.
meanings.sent3: The conversation degenerated into a silly argument about cats.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship slowly degenerated into indifference.
meanings.sent5: The once beautiful painting began to degenerate with age.

meanings.definition: A person who has declined in physical, mental, or moral qualities.
meanings.sent1: The man was known in the town as a degenerate gambler.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the degenerate crowd at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The degenerate at the party told jokes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as a degenerate, lost in a sea of bad decisions.
meanings.sent5: The detective was on the lookout for the degenerate criminal.
